model
Class GameboardImp

java.lang.Object
  model.GameboardImp
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Cloneable, Gameboard
public class GameboardImp
extends java.lang.Object
implements Gameboard, java.lang.Cloneable

An implementation for the gameboard model for the TTT system. Keeps track of the board and what pieces are where

Version:
1.0
Author:
Benjamin Pellittieri and Christopher Pauliks for Mustache Cash Stash

requestMove

public boolean requestMove(int xPosition,
                           int yPosition,
                           PlaceValue pieceToPlace)
Description copied from interface: Gameboard
A request from a client to place a piece on the Gameboard at a certain position. The Gameboard should check whether the move is in turn and is valid before placing the piece.

Specified by:
requestMove in interface Gameboard
Parameters:
xPosition - The x (horizontal) coordinate of the requested space to occupy
yPosition - The y (vertical) coordinate of the requested space to occupy
pieceToPlace - The type of piece to put in the requested location.
Returns:
Whether the move request was successful in updating the Gameboard.

coordToRows

private java.util.LinkedList<java.lang.Integer> coordToRows(int x,
                                                            int y)
Returns a List of the rows the requested space is part of. Rows numbers are as follows, corresponding to the same rows in the rowStates array; 6 3 4 5 7 0 [0,0][0,1][0,2] 1 [1,0][1,1][1,2] 2 [2,0][2,1][2,2]

Parameters:
x - X coordinate of the space
y - Y coordinate of the space
Returns:
The requested List

the current status of the game

forceMove

private void forceMove(int xPosition,
                       int yPosition,
                       PlaceValue piece)
Private version of RequestMove. Actually places the piece on the board.

Parameters:
xPosition - The x (horizontal) coordinate of the requested space to occupy
yPosition - The y (vertical) coordinate of the requested space to occupy
piece - The type of piece to put in the location
